steps.title: Marketing Styles
steps.narration: marketing.css handles landing pages and catalog pages. Hero sections, feature grids, testimonials‚Äîall the public-facing flair!

steps.title: Landing Page
steps.narration: The landing page is the first impression. Hero section, value props, call-to-action‚Äîall styled by marketing.css.

steps.title: Course Catalog
steps.narration: The catalog showcases all available courses. Card grids, filters, course previews‚Äîmarketing.css makes it shine.

steps.title: Auth Styles
steps.narration: auth.css styles login and registration forms. Centered cards, input fields, validation messages‚Äîclean and focused.

steps.title: Login Page
steps.narration: The login page is minimal and focused. Email, password, submit‚Äîno distractions, just authentication.

steps.title: Register Page
steps.narration: Registration adds display name to the form. Same clean styling, slightly longer form, welcoming new users.

steps.title: Dashboard Styles
steps.narration: dashboard.css creates the user hub layout. Sidebar navigation, stats cards, course grids, activity feeds.

steps.title: User Dashboard
steps.narration: The dashboard is the user's home base. Progress overview, enrolled courses, recent activity‚Äîall in one place.

steps.title: Lesson Styles
steps.narration: lesson.css is the richest file. Content sections, code blocks, quizzes, drag-drop zones, progress indicators!

steps.title: Lesson Pages
steps.narration: Every lesson page uses these styles. Interactive content, readable typography, engaging activities.

steps.title: Blog Styles
steps.narration: blog.css handles article formatting. Long-form content, images, code snippets‚Äîoptimized for reading.

steps.title: Blog Pages
steps.narration: Blog articles share knowledge beyond courses. Same quality typography and styling, different content focus.

steps.title: CSS Custom Properties
steps.narration: All design tokens live in the root selector as CSS custom properties. One source of truth for the entire design system!

steps.title: Color Palette
steps.narration: Colors define the dark theme aesthetic. Primary backgrounds, accent colors, success and error states. Carefully chosen for contrast!

steps.title: Primary Background
steps.narration: bg-primary is the darkest at hash 0a0a0f. The main canvas color, providing maximum contrast for content.

steps.title: Secondary Background
steps.narration: bg-secondary is slightly lighter at hash 12121a. Used for cards and elevated surfaces to create depth.

steps.title: Primary Accent
steps.narration: accent-primary is our signature purple. Links, buttons, interactive elements‚Äîit draws the eye to action!

steps.title: Success Color
steps.narration: accent-success is a vibrant green. Correct answers, completed tasks, positive feedback‚Äîcelebration in color!

steps.title: Spacing Scale
steps.narration: Spacing tokens create consistent rhythm. Small, medium, large‚Äîpredictable gaps throughout the UI.

steps.title: Small Spacing
steps.narration: spacing-sm is half a rem. Tight gaps between related elements, compact but not cramped.

steps.title: Medium Spacing
steps.narration: spacing-md is one rem. The default gap, comfortable separation between most elements.

steps.title: Large Spacing
steps.narration: spacing-lg is one and a half rem. Section separators, content breaks, breathing room!

steps.title: Typography
steps.narration: Two font families define our look. Inter for body text‚Äîclean and readable. Space Grotesk for headings‚Äîbold and modern!

steps.title: Body Font
steps.narration: Inter is our body font. Excellent legibility at all sizes, perfect for long-form content reading.

steps.title: Display Font
steps.narration: Space Grotesk is for headings. Bold geometric shapes make titles pop and grab attention.

steps.title: Effects
steps.narration: Shadows and transitions bring the UI to life. Subtle effects, big impact on polish!

steps.title: Medium Shadow
steps.narration: shadow-md adds depth to cards and modals. Soft edges, subtle elevation‚Äîprofessional polish.

steps.title: Standard Transition
steps.narration: transition-medium is 300ms ease. Smooth state changes, not too fast, not too slow. Just right!

steps.title: Page Load Trigger
steps.narration: Page load triggers entrance animations. Content fades in, elements stagger into view. First impressions matter!

steps.title: Scroll Trigger
steps.narration: Scrolling triggers reveal animations. As users explore, content animates into the viewport. Progressive discovery!

steps.title: Hover Trigger
steps.narration: Mouse hover triggers interactive feedback. Buttons grow, cards lift, colors shift. Immediate response to user intent!

steps.title: Click Trigger
steps.narration: Clicks trigger action animations. Ripples, expansions, state transitions. Confirming user actions visually!

steps.title: IntersectionObserver
steps.narration: IntersectionObserver efficiently detects visibility. No scroll event spam‚Äîjust precise threshold crossings.

steps.title: Anime.js Engine
steps.narration: Anime.js handles complex animations. Staggered reveals, elastic easing, timeline sequences‚Äîsmooth and performant!

steps.title: CSS Transitions
steps.narration: Simple interactions use CSS transitions. Hover effects, focus states, color changes‚Äîno JavaScript needed!

steps.title: Fade In Effect
steps.narration: The signature fade-in: opacity zero to one, translateY 20 to zero. Content rises into view. Elegant!

steps.title: Stagger Effect
steps.narration: Stagger delays each element slightly. Lists and grids cascade into view‚Äîdynamic and engaging!

steps.title: Slide Effect
steps.narration: Slide animations move elements horizontally or vertically. Drawers open, panels expand, content shifts!

steps.title: Scale Effect
steps.narration: Scale transforms resize elements. Buttons grow on hover, cards enlarge on focus. Subtle emphasis!

steps.title: Color Change
steps.narration: Color transitions shift hues smoothly. Hover states, active states, focus states‚Äîall visually distinct.

steps.title: Card Component
steps.narration: Cards are our primary container pattern. A dark background with border, holding header, content, and footer sections.

steps.title: Card Header
steps.narration: Card headers contain titles and icons. Consistent padding, bold typography‚Äîimmediately scannable.

steps.title: Card Content
steps.narration: Card content is flexible. Lists, paragraphs, charts, forms‚Äîany content fits within the card structure.

steps.title: Card Footer
steps.narration: Card footers hold actions. Buttons, links, timestamps‚Äîeverything that lets users take next steps.

steps.title: Card Hover State
steps.narration: On hover, cards lift slightly and borders brighten. Subtle feedback that says 'this is interactive!'

steps.title: Button Base
steps.narration: Buttons have a base class with shared styles. Padding, border-radius, font‚Äîconsistent across variants.

steps.title: Primary Button
steps.narration: Primary buttons demand attention. Solid accent background, high contrast text‚Äîthe main call to action.

steps.title: Secondary Button
steps.narration: Secondary buttons are subtle. Outlined style, lower visual weight‚Äîfor alternative actions.

steps.title: Progress Bar Container
steps.narration: Progress bars show completion visually. A container track with a fill element inside.

steps.title: Progress Fill
steps.narration: The fill element shows actual progress. Width percentage equals progress percentage‚Äîsimple and clear!

steps.title: Dashboard Layout
steps.narration: Dashboard uses a sidebar plus main content pattern. Fixed navigation on the left, scrollable content on the right.

steps.title: Sidebar Navigation
steps.narration: The sidebar provides persistent navigation. 240 pixels wide, fixed position‚Äîalways accessible!

steps.title: Main Content Area
steps.narration: Main content fills the remaining space with flex-grow. Scrollable, responsive, the star of the show!

steps.title: Dashboard Page
steps.narration: The dashboard page uses this layout. User's home base with sidebar navigation always available.

steps.title: Lesson Layout
steps.narration: Lesson pages have three columns: fixed header, scrollable content center, progress nav on the right.

steps.title: Fixed Header
steps.narration: A 60-pixel header stays at the top. Course title, breadcrumb, quick actions‚Äîcontext always visible.

steps.title: Progress Navigation
steps.narration: Right sidebar tracks scroll position. Jump to sections, see progress at a glance, navigate efficiently!

steps.title: Lesson Pages
steps.narration: All lesson pages share this layout. Consistent learning experience across all courses.

steps.title: Marketing Layout
steps.narration: Marketing pages use full-width sections. No sidebar, no constraints‚Äîbold visual storytelling!

steps.title: Hero Section
steps.narration: The hero section is the first impression. Full-width, bold headline, compelling CTA‚Äîcapture attention!

steps.title: Card Grid
steps.narration: Auto-fill grids showcase features or courses. Responsive columns, consistent cards, easy scanning.

steps.title: Landing Page
steps.narration: The landing page showcases the platform. Hero, features, testimonials‚Äîscroll through the story!

steps.title: Auth Layout
steps.narration: Auth pages center a single form card. Maximum focus on the task‚Äîsign in or register.

steps.title: Centered Form Card
steps.narration: A max-width form card centers vertically and horizontally. Clean, focused, distraction-free!

steps.title: Auth Pages
steps.narration: Login and register share this layout. Consistent authentication experience.

steps.title: Quiz Container
steps.narration: Every quiz starts with a container. The data-answer attribute holds the correct answer‚Äîhidden from the UI but accessible to JavaScript.

steps.title: Question Text
steps.narration: The question is displayed prominently. Clear typography, adequate spacing‚Äîthe user knows exactly what to answer.

steps.title: Options Container
steps.narration: Options are grouped in a container. Vertical list or grid, depending on content length.

steps.title: Individual Option
steps.narration: Each option has a data-value attribute. Click to select‚Äîvisual feedback confirms the choice.

steps.title: Submit Button
steps.narration: The submit button triggers validation. Disabled until a selection is made, then ready for action!

steps.title: Feedback Area
steps.narration: The feedback area reveals after submission. Correct answer, explanation, encouragement‚Äîlearning moment!

steps.title: Selected State
steps.narration: Clicking an option adds the selected class. Border highlight, background change‚Äîclear visual selection!

steps.title: Correct State
steps.narration: After submission, the correct answer gets the correct class. Green border, checkmark‚Äîcelebration!

steps.title: Incorrect State
steps.narration: Wrong selections get the incorrect class. Red border, x-mark‚Äîbut with helpful explanation below!

steps.title: Mobile First
steps.narration: Below 768 pixels is mobile territory. Single column layouts, hidden sidebars, stacked navigation. Touch-friendly targets!

steps.title: Single Column
steps.narration: On mobile, content stacks vertically. No side-by-side layouts‚Äîeverything flows top to bottom for easy scrolling.

steps.title: Hidden Sidebar
steps.narration: Sidebars collapse to hamburger menus on mobile. Screen space is precious‚Äîcontent comes first!

steps.title: Tablet Range
steps.narration: 768 to 1024 pixels is tablet territory. More space allows for some side-by-side layouts.

steps.title: Two Columns
steps.narration: Two-column grids appear on tablets. Course cards side by side, better use of horizontal space.

steps.title: Desktop Layout
steps.narration: 1024 to 1280 pixels is desktop range. Full layouts with visible sidebars, multi-column grids, expanded navigation.

steps.title: Full Layout
steps.narration: Desktop shows the complete layout. Sidebar visible, three-column lessons, all features accessible.

steps.title: Large Screens
steps.narration: Above 1280 pixels, we add constraints. Content doesn't stretch infinitely‚Äîreadable line lengths are maintained.

steps.title: Max Width Container
steps.narration: Max-width containers center content on large screens. 1200 pixel limit keeps text readable and layouts balanced.

steps.title: Primary Background
steps.narration: bg-primary is the darkest background at hash 0a0a0f. Nearly black, it provides maximum contrast for text.

steps.title: Secondary Background
steps.narration: bg-secondary at hash 12121a is slightly elevated. Used for cards and containers to create depth.

steps.title: Card Background
steps.narration: bg-card at hash 16162a is even lighter. Cards pop against the page background. Visual hierarchy through shade!

steps.title: Primary Text
steps.narration: text-primary is light gray at hash e8e8f0. Against bg-primary, it achieves 15.2:1 contrast‚Äîwell above WCAG requirements!

steps.title: Secondary Text
steps.narration: text-secondary at hash a8a8b8 is slightly dimmer. 8.5:1 contrast for less prominent text‚Äîstill highly readable.

steps.title: Muted Text
steps.narration: text-muted at hash 6a6a80 is the lightest text. 4.6:1 contrast‚Äîfor hints, placeholders, de-emphasized content.

steps.title: Primary Accent
steps.narration: accent-primary purple achieves 6.8:1 contrast on card backgrounds. Links and interactive elements stand out!

steps.title: Success Green
steps.narration: accent-success at hash 66bb6a achieves 8.1:1 contrast. Perfect for positive feedback without being harsh.

steps.title: Error Red
steps.narration: accent-error red achieves 5.2:1 contrast. Clear error indication while remaining readable on dark backgrounds.

questions.question: What font family is used for headings?
questions.explanation: Space Grotesk is the display font used for headings‚Äîbold and modern.

questions.question: Where are all design tokens defined?
questions.explanation: All design tokens live in the :root selector as CSS custom properties.

questions.question: What library handles complex animations?
questions.explanation: Anime.js handles complex animations like staggered reveals and timeline sequences.

questions.question: What triggers scroll-based animations?
questions.explanation: IntersectionObserver efficiently triggers animations as sections enter the viewport.

questions.question: At what width do sidebars become visible on desktop?
questions.explanation: Desktop layouts with visible sidebars appear at 1024px and above.

questions.question: Why do large screens have max-width containers?
questions.explanation: Max-width containers prevent content from stretching too wide, maintaining readable line lengths.
